name: Hotel Le Cantlie Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed at the Cantlie Suites hotel for one night with my 2 grandchildren ages 10 and 12. I had a king suite with a king bed in a room with french doors and a fold out queen sofa. I phoned the hotel directly and asked about any specials and they said they would match any price I found on the internet that could be verified.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at the Cantlie Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel at about 11:30 am. There is no drive around entrance to the hotel, so you have to park/stop on Sherbrooke or Peel - not easy, but I found a semi legal parking space and puit my 4-ways on. My room was ready when I arrived which was great. We went up right away and stowed our stuff. The room was very clean, the king bed was very comfy with a lovely white duvet and good pillows. We asked to have the fold out bed made up and left for most of the day. The only negative was that I didn't ask for a non-smoking room, as I assumed hotel rooms usually are non-smoking. There was a smell of cigar when you opened the room, but after a minute in the room, it wasn't noticable. The front desk staff were very pleasant and when we returned at about 4 pm, the sofa bed was made up.
reviews.title: You can do better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The valet parking staff were also very pleasant and helpful. I had to retrieve a few things from the car and they were very nice.
reviews.title: great location - crappy hotel and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very convenient to the metro and taxis are always close by.
reviews.title: service, service, service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For this hotel I would say the pluses are its great location, friendly staff and reasonable price. The hotel could do with some updating - especially the pool which is painted concrete and very utilitarian looking. The views of Montreal from the rooftop are great The bathroom was small, as noted in other reviews and the TV is small and older, but it worked just fine. The fridge and AC are not noisy which was good as the sofa bed is near the AC fan. We noticed that the room had a small balcony which couldn't be accessed as all windows etc were caulked and painted shut. Too bad!
reviews.title: Good value, comfortable, but dated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great choice for a long weekend mini vacation. The bed was very plush and comfortable with down dovet covers and feather pillows. Just like home! The staff were helpful and friendly. I have to recommend a restaurant on Peel that was wonderful. The Universal Restaurant is a must. We ate there a few times. Really great food and excellent service. The Metro is on Peel one block down and the entrance to the underground mall is two blocks south on Peel. This hotel is dated, currently being renovated externally, and needs alot of TLC.
reviews.title: The bed was the best part of this hotel stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for four nights and really enjoyed this hotel. Having a small kitchen came in very handy - not being a big breakfast eater, we were able to eat a light breakfast in our room. Lots of good restaurants nearby, and it was a short walk to the tourist info centre. The room was clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again!
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Montreal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in the centre of Montreal's shopping district and is close to the metro. The suites had its own kitchenette which includes a microwave, toaster and some cutlery/plates/bowls. We stayed at two different rooms in this hotel through our trip and although we paid the same price, the rooms were fairly different, one was more modern looking, had 1 bed and a sofa bed but didn't have a stove and the other had a stove and 2 king beds but more outdated look. The buffet breakfast (included in our package) was nice, had sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs, french toast, potatoes, baked goods, cereals and fruits.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 10 days at the hotel. We picked that hotel because of our long stay we wanted to be comfortable. The hotel was way more expensive than many others available. It provides sort of a seperate living room and a small kitchen very badly equiped, everything is old and falling apart. This allows the hotel to label their room as "suites" and claim the extra $$$. The bathroom is 1960 style with not updates, there is definetly a problem with the plumbing, after a shower you can swim in the tub and the towells provided are awful. I don't think that the place has been painted in the last 20 years. All the accessories/equipment in the room are so badly abused (ironing board, iron, hair dryer etc) , you do not feel like using them. The bed is nice and comfortable, but for the price we paied when we were there you can get a lot of truly higher end hotel.
reviews.title: Great location but that is it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were in Toronto for a long stay and lived in Cambridge Suites Hotel. Very similar $$$$ but felt a lot better about the hotel. I recommend Cambridge but do not recommend Cantlie. The extra you are paying for the suite is not worth it.
reviews.title: It was a wonderful experience in a quaint hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is showing its age. Had to call for towels and washclothes 3 times. Remote didn't work. Bottom of toilet was not clean. Bed linen was fresh. The TV was small. Could not leave a tip for bad service. Should have stayed at the Sofitel across the street.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid a premium to stay here during Grand Prix weekend. The good points about this hotel is the location formost. Right by Mont Royal walkway, metro, and all kinds of shops and restaurants. It is just a couple blocks from the Ritz-Carlton and across from the Sofitel. Bed was super comfortable and the suite with French doors leading to the bed was charming and spacious. Full kitchen was convenient.
reviews.title: Great location, needs renovation and horrible Internet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now for the negatives: decor and hotel in general is dated and needs to be fully renovated. The bathroom was extremely cramped and can only have one person in it at a time and even then is a tight fit. The hotel uses regular keys on a large card which is not only inconvenient to carry but can pose a security issue. Gym and pool facilities were unimpressive although there were nice views form the rooftop.
reviews.title: Terrific stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now to the biggest issue of all, the Internet! Not only was it not free, but it didn't work probably 75% of the time! Wifi would connect but would time out often and could take over 5 minutes to load a single page. It would work sporadically but over the course of 4 days the issue persisted. It would take 30 minutes to do what could normally be done in 15. If you are a businessperson do not stay here! Even just for leisure it was a huge inconvenience beacuse we were trying to look up maps, directions, and restaurant reviews. At checkout this was mentioned to the front desk and they were no help at all, didn't apologize or offer to take all or some of the Internet bill off.
reviews.title: Great Location, Nice Suite, Good Value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would only stay here if you can get a really good deal, don't mind dated old decor, and don't need to use the Internet.
reviews.title: Not fancy, but for the price....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is vey well located, just two blocks from famous Rue St. Catherine and a 5 minutes walk from the Bell Center. The staff was very friendly and gave us a two bed room with an extra sofa bed since we were three friends together. The room was very spacious, not very modern but clean and also the bathroom was OK. There is also parking opportunity in the hotel but not free of charge.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel in the heart of Montreal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The surrounding area is good for shopping, dining and also for going out. Rue Crescent with all it's bars and irish pubs is also in walking distance. Also McGill is close and you can walk to the Mont Royal. The nearest Metro Station is "Peel".
reviews.title: Spacious, well-maintained 70s era modern suites hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I would highlight the spacious rooms and the friendly staff in Le Cantlie Suites. I would definitely go there again.
reviews.title: Great room for price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Cantlie is a throwback to a time when hotel designers thought that a suites hotel should come with a reasonable amount of floor space, something close to a full kitchen, and a workable living area -- as well as a reasonable sized bedroom.
reviews.title: Better places elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The desk personnel at the Cantlie couldn't tell me when it was built, but my guess in the 70s. The floor plate is modest, but the hotel rises high above the street, and every suite has a concrete balcony. There are generous windows, so very good daylight. The kitchens include a real oven, plus stovetop, plus fridge, with tableware, all in an alcove. The bathrooms are not large, and don't include a control valve on the hot and cold, but they are consistent with the era. Located right across from the Sofitel, on Sherbrooke Street just west of McGill, the neighbourhood offers a range of restaurant options as well as shopping, art galleries, and proximity to all kinds of facilities.
reviews.title: Great deal and perfect location with excellent staff

description: The intimate, boutique style Hotel Le Cantlie Suites is located in the center of downtown, within Montreal’s Golden Square Mile and offers impressive city and Mount Royal views.The spacious rooms offer a choice of queen or king beds, signature toiletries and feature a mini fridge, microwave and many more comforting amenities.The fully licensed Le Mezz Restaurant presents varied menus, from a full buffet breakfast to lunch and dinner a la carte.Available on site is indoor valet parking $, WiFi in room and in public areas $, new fully equipped fitness center, outdoor rooftop swimming pool and lounge deck all offering stunning views.
